TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG were represented by PERSON PERSON GPE , ORG at ORG . In view of the applicant ’s nationality , the Government of GPE were invited to submit written comments on the case . CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested and charged with attempted murder , robbery and illegal firearms trafficking . His pre - trial detention was extended on several occasions .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , in a jury trial , convicted the applicant as charged and sentenced him to fifteen years’ imprisonment .
On DATE ORG upheld the conviction on appeal .

CARDINAL . Following the applicant ’s request , on DATE the ORG of ORG of GPE quashed the judgment of DATE , as upheld on CARDINAL DATE , by way of supervisory review , and remitted the case for a retrial .

CARDINAL . The applicant did not appeal against that judgment .
CARDINAL . During his arrest on DATE the applicant received a number of serious injuries , including gunshot wounds and fractures of the lower limbs , craniocerebral injury and concussion .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken to GPE hospital no . CARDINAL , where he received primary surgical treatment for the gunshot wounds and had plaster casts applied to the fractures . He was subsequently transferred to GPE hospital no . CARDINAL , where he stayed until DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was placed in GPE remand prison IZCARDINAL/CARDINAL . Upon his admission , the applicant was examined by a surgeon and discovered to have a perforating gunshot wound of the right thigh , a nonperforating gunshot wound of the left gluteal region , a closed fracture ( immobilised ) of left medial malleolus , a fracture ( immobilised ) of the lower third of the right shinbone , a fracture of the proximal phalanx of the hallux of the right foot , and a closed craniocerebral injury . He was subsequently hospitalised in the surgical unit of the remand prison hospital .

CARDINAL . In the surgical unit of the remand prison hospital the applicant was further diagnosed with concussion and traumatic neuropathy of the right median nerve . His condition was evaluated as “ moderately severe ” . The applicant was treated with antibacterial , anti - inflammatory , general health - improving , anaesthetic , local , antispasmodic and sedative medication .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was discharged from the IZ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL prison hospital in a satisfactory condition , after which he received outpatient treatment at the IZ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL medical unit .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a request with the acting Prosecutor of GPE asking for his transfer from remand prison IZ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL to GPE hospital no . CARDINAL for specialised treatment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant underwent elective surgery for the removal of CARDINAL bullets from the soft tissue of his right thigh and the sacral region .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again underwent an expert medicosocial examination and was found to have no signs of persistent disability . The applicant ’s continued classification as disabled , therefore , was not required .

CARDINAL . On DATE he was admitted to correctional colony IK-CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s parents applied to the governor of GPE remand prison IZ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL asking for the applicant ’s transfer back to prison hospital PERSON , without success .
DATE . On DATE the applicant was released from prison .

CARDINAL . The federal law on the detention of persons suspected of and charged with criminal offences ( Federal Law no . CARDINAL of DATE ) provides that inmates are entitled to medical assistance ( section CARDINAL ) . If an inmate ’s health deteriorates , the medical officers of the remand prison are obliged to examine him promptly and inform him of the results of the examination in writing . If the inmate requests to be examined by staff of other medical institutions , the administration of the detention facility is to organise such an examination . If the administration refuses , the refusal can be appealed against to a prosecutor or court . If an inmate is suffering from a serious disease , the administration of the remand prison is obliged immediately to inform the prosecutor , who can carry out an inquiry into the matter ( section CARDINAL ) .
